name: OCI File Storage File System Export is publicly accessible
description:
This policy identifies the OCI File Storage File Systems Exports that are publicly accessible. Monitoring and alerting on publicly accessible file systems exports will help in identifying changes to the security posture and thus reduces risk for sensitive data being leaked. It is recommended that no File System exports be publicly  accessible.
FMI : https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/File/Tasks/exportoptions.htm#scenarios
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'oci' AND api.name = 'oci-file-storage-file-system' as X; config from cloud.resource where api.name = 'oci-file-storage-export' AND json.rule = (exportOptions[?any(source equals 0.0.0.0/0 and requirePrivilegedSourcePort is false and access equals READ_WRITE and identitySquash equals NONE)] exists) as Y; filter '($.X.id equals $.Y.fileSystemId)';show X;
recommendation:
1. Login to the OCI Console
2. Type the resource reported in the alert into the Search box at the top of the Console.
3. Click the resource reported in the alert from the Resources submenu
4. Click on the alerted Export Path from the list of Exports
5. Click on the Edit NFS Export Options
6. Edit the export options to make it more restrictive
7. Click Update
